intro: Saurauia luzoniensis, commonly known as the Luzon saurauia, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries. The plant is characterized by its small, leathery leaves and clusters of bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in montane forests and is adapted to cool, moist environments. Due to its restricted habitat, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
